alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 08 at 6:27PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Gainesville, Whitesboro, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Callisburg, Knollwood, Dorchester, Lake Kiowa, Lake Texoma, Southmayd, Sadler, Oak Ridge, Ethel, Dixie, Woodbine, Burns and Lake Ray Roberts.
